content.prompt: Lobe-finned fishes were present in the oceans of the world approximately 400 million years ago. The first tetrapods (vertebrates that had limbs and could move on land) date to about 365 million years ago. One hypothesis states that early tetrapods evolved from lobe-finned fishes. Which of the following is the best plan for testing the hypothesis?

choices.label: Determining the number of fins found on lobe-finned fishes from different geographical locations
Measuring the proportion of radioisotopes found in fossils of early tetrapods
Comparing the arrangements of bones in the fins of lobe-finned fishes and limbs of the earliest tetrapods
Sequencing DNA isolated from fossils of lobe-finned fishes to determine the size of the genome
